\chapter{Installation Guide}
\label{\detokenize{installation:installation-guide}}\label{\detokenize{installation:installation}}\label{\detokenize{installation::doc}}

\section{Prerequisites}
\label{\detokenize{installation:prerequisites}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Before installing the project, ensure you have the following prerequisites:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Python 3.8 or higher

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
pip (Python package installer)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Git

\end{itemize}


\section{Installation Steps}
\label{\detokenize{installation:installation-steps}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Clone the repository:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/iftucl/ift\PYGZus{}coursework\PYGZus{}2024.git
\PYG{n+nb}{cd}\PYG{+w}{ }ift\PYGZus{}coursework\PYGZus{}2024/team\PYGZus{}Ginkgo
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create a virtual environment (recommended):

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}m\PYG{+w}{ }venv\PYG{+w}{ }venv
\PYG{n+nb}{source}\PYG{+w}{ }venv/bin/activate\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} On Windows, use: venv\PYGZbs{}Scripts\PYGZbs{}activate}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Install required packages:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}r\PYG{+w}{ }requirements.txt
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{enumerate}


\section{Configuration}
\label{\detokenize{installation:configuration}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Set up environment variables:

\sphinxAtStartPar
Create a \sphinxtitleref{.env} file in the project root with the following variables:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nv}{MINIO\PYGZus{}ENDPOINT}\PYG{o}{=}your\PYGZus{}minio\PYGZus{}endpoint
\PYG{n+nv}{MINIO\PYGZus{}ACCESS\PYGZus{}KEY}\PYG{o}{=}your\PYGZus{}access\PYGZus{}key
\PYG{n+nv}{MINIO\PYGZus{}SECRET\PYGZus{}KEY}\PYG{o}{=}your\PYGZus{}secret\PYGZus{}key
\PYG{n+nv}{MINIO\PYGZus{}BUCKET\PYGZus{}NAME}\PYG{o}{=}your\PYGZus{}bucket\PYGZus{}name
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Configure the database:

\sphinxAtStartPar
Update the database configuration in \sphinxtitleref{config.py} if needed.

\end{enumerate}


\section{Verification}
\label{\detokenize{installation:verification}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To verify the installation:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Run the tests:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}m\PYG{+w}{ }pytest\PYG{+w}{ }tests/
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Start the application:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python\PYG{+w}{ }modules/main.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
If you encounter any issues during installation, please refer to the troubleshooting section or raise an issue on the GitHub repository.

\chapter{Usage Guide}
\label{\detokenize{usage:usage-guide}}\label{\detokenize{usage:usage}}\label{\detokenize{usage::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This guide explains how to use the main features of the Team Ginkgo project.


\section{Basic Usage}
\label{\detokenize{usage:basic-usage}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The project consists of several modules that work together to scrape, process, and store financial data.


\section{Running the Scraper}
\label{\detokenize{usage:running-the-scraper}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The scraper module can be used to collect financial data:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{modules}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{scraper}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{FinancialDataScraper}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Initialize the scraper}
\PYG{n}{scraper} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{FinancialDataScraper}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Start scraping data}
\PYG{n}{scraper}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{start\PYGZus{}scraping}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Using the MinIO Client}
\label{\detokenize{usage:using-the-minio-client}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Store and retrieve data using the MinIO client:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{modules}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{minio\PYGZus{}client}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{MinioClient}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Initialize the client}
\PYG{n}{minio\PYGZus{}client} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{MinioClient}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Upload data}
\PYG{n}{minio\PYGZus{}client}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{upload\PYGZus{}file}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{local\PYGZus{}file.csv}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{remote\PYGZus{}file.csv}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Download data}
\PYG{n}{minio\PYGZus{}client}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{download\PYGZus{}file}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{remote\PYGZus{}file.csv}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{local\PYGZus{}file.csv}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Database Operations}
\label{\detokenize{usage:database-operations}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Interact with the database:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{modules}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{database}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Database}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Initialize database connection}
\PYG{n}{db} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Database}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Store data}
\PYG{n}{db}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{store\PYGZus{}data}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{data\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Query data}
\PYG{n}{results} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{db}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{query\PYGZus{}data}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{query\PYGZus{}params}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Scheduling Tasks}
\label{\detokenize{usage:scheduling-tasks}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the scheduler to automate tasks:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{modules}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{scheduler}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Scheduler}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Initialize scheduler}
\PYG{n}{scheduler} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Scheduler}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Add a task}
\PYG{n}{scheduler}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{add\PYGZus{}task}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{task\PYGZus{}function}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{0 */1 * * *}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Run every hour}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Start the scheduler}
\PYG{n}{scheduler}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{start}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Configuration}
\label{\detokenize{usage:configuration}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Modify the configuration in \sphinxtitleref{config.py}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{modules}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{config}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Config}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Load configuration}
\PYG{n}{config} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Config}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Access configuration values}
\PYG{n}{endpoint} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{config}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{MINIO\PYGZus{}ENDPOINT}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Error Handling}
\label{\detokenize{usage:error-handling}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The project includes comprehensive error handling. Hereâ€™s how to handle common errors:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{try}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Your code here}
    \PYG{n}{scraper}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{start\PYGZus{}scraping}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{k}{except} \PYG{n+ne}{ConnectionError} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n}{e}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Connection error: }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{e}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{k}{except} \PYG{n+ne}{Exception} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n}{e}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Unexpected error: }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{e}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Best Practices}
\label{\detokenize{usage:best-practices}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Always use environment variables for sensitive information

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Regularly backup your data

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Monitor the logs for any issues

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Follow the rate limiting guidelines when scraping

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Use appropriate error handling

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For more detailed examples and advanced usage, refer to the API Reference section.

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Architecture Overview}
\label{\detokenize{architecture:architecture-overview}}\label{\detokenize{architecture:architecture}}\label{\detokenize{architecture::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This document provides a comprehensive overview of the Team Ginkgo project architecture.


\section{System Components}
\label{\detokenize{architecture:system-components}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The project consists of several key components:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Data Collection Layer
\sphinxhyphen{} Web Scraper (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{scraper.py}})
\sphinxhyphen{} Scheduler (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{scheduler.py}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Storage Layer
\sphinxhyphen{} MinIO Client (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{minio\_client.py}})
\sphinxhyphen{} Database Interface (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{database.py}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Configuration
\sphinxhyphen{} Configuration Management (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{config.py}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Main Application
\sphinxhyphen{} Application Entry Point (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{main.py}})

\end{enumerate}


\section{Component Interactions}
\label{\detokenize{architecture:component-interactions}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\section{Data Flow}
\label{\detokenize{architecture:data-flow}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Data Collection
\sphinxhyphen{} The scraper collects financial data from various sources
\sphinxhyphen{} Scheduled tasks are managed by the scheduler
\sphinxhyphen{} Data is validated and preprocessed

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Data Storage
\sphinxhyphen{} Raw data is stored in MinIO object storage
\sphinxhyphen{} Processed data is stored in the database
\sphinxhyphen{} Data versioning is maintained

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Data Access
\sphinxhyphen{} API endpoints for data retrieval
\sphinxhyphen{} Query interface for database access
\sphinxhyphen{} File operations for MinIO storage

\end{enumerate}


\section{Technology Stack}
\label{\detokenize{architecture:technology-stack}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Programming Language}: Python 3.8+

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Object Storage}: MinIO

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Database}: PostgreSQL

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Task Scheduling}: APScheduler

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Web Scraping}: BeautifulSoup4, Requests

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Configuration}: Python\sphinxhyphen{}dotenv

\end{itemize}


\section{Security Considerations}
\label{\detokenize{architecture:security-considerations}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Authentication
\sphinxhyphen{} MinIO access credentials
\sphinxhyphen{} Database connection security
\sphinxhyphen{} API authentication

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Data Protection
\sphinxhyphen{} Encrypted storage
\sphinxhyphen{} Secure data transmission
\sphinxhyphen{} Access control

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Error Handling
\sphinxhyphen{} Graceful failure recovery
\sphinxhyphen{} Error logging and monitoring
\sphinxhyphen{} Data consistency checks

\end{enumerate}


\section{Scalability}
\label{\detokenize{architecture:scalability}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The architecture is designed to be scalable:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Horizontal Scaling
\sphinxhyphen{} Multiple scraper instances
\sphinxhyphen{} Distributed storage
\sphinxhyphen{} Load balancing

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Vertical Scaling
\sphinxhyphen{} Resource allocation
\sphinxhyphen{} Performance optimization
\sphinxhyphen{} Cache management

\end{enumerate}

\chapter{API Reference}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:api-reference}}\label{\detokenize{api_reference:id1}}\label{\detokenize{api_reference::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This section provides detailed documentation for all modules and their components.


\section{Scraper Module}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:scraper-module}}

\label{\detokenize{api_reference:minio-client-module}}

\label{\detokenize{api_reference:database-module}}

\label{\detokenize{api_reference:scheduler-module}}

\section{Configuration Module}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:configuration-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!config@\spxentry{config}}\index{config@\spxentry{config}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:module-config}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This file contains the configuration for the project.
The main configuration settings include:
\sphinxhyphen{} Google API Key
\sphinxhyphen{} Google Custom Search Engine ID
\sphinxhyphen{} Database Configuration
\sphinxhyphen{} MINIO Configuration
These settings are used by the different modules of the project to interact with external services and resources.
For example, the Google API Key is used to access Google Custom Search API, the Database Configuration is used to connect to the SQL database, and the MINIO Configuration is used to store and retrieve files from the MINIO object storage service.
